text: General elections were held in Singapore on Saturday, 3 May 2025 to elect all 97 members of the Parliament of Singapore across 33 constituencies. Lee Hsien Loong did not lead the People's Action Party (PAP), as Lawrence Wong succeeded him as Prime Minister on 15 May 2024 and as secretary-general of the PAP on 4 December that year. The PAP has won the majority of seats in every election since independence. ==Electoral system== Under Article 65(4) of the Singaporean Constitution, a parliamentary term lasts a maximum of five years. However, the Prime Minister, with a vote from a majority of sitting Members of Parliament (MPs), can advise the President for early dissolution at any time. A general election must be held within three months of dissolution. === Political parties === The table below lists political parties elected or nominated in Parliament after the 2020 parliamentary election: Name Leader Ideology Votes (%) Seats Status Last election Non-constituency At dissolution People's Action Party (PAP) Lawrence Wong Conservatism Civic nationalism Workers' Party (WP) Pritam Singh Social democracy Parliamentarism Progress Singapore Party (PSP) Tan Cheng Bock Progressivism Social liberalism Vacant colspan=5 ==== Pre-election composition ==== ==Results== ==Notes== ==References== Category:2020s in Singapore Category:2020s elections in Asia Category:2025 elections Category:General elections Category:Events in Singapore Category:May 2025 events
title: 2025 Singaporean general election
